g.text: Comparison and determination of average temperature
The construction of the CCT diagram(Figure
) of the experimental steel AISI 4340 was created
from all eight expansion curves. For its accurate compilation, it was necessary to analyze dilatation
curves and evaluate the microstructure of the measured samples, which conﬁrms the formation of the
phases in the dilatation curves. The austenitization temperature was set at 850
. To achieve the transformation of the austenite in the whole sample volume,
the holding time at the austenitizing temperature was 30 min. We determined the temperatures of
using expansion curves during heating. The CCT diagramof experimental high-strength steel
AISI 4340 consists of three transformation phases. The ﬁrst phase occurred in the ﬁrst four dilatation
curves up to a cooling rate of 1
and consists only in martensite. We observed the formation
of a second phase at a cooling rate of 0.5
, which was a bainite. This resulting bainitic region
continues until the last dilatation curve, which has been cooled at a rate of 0.01
A third transformation phase also occurred in the CCT diagram, which is located above the
bainitic region and is formed by a ferrite. The ferritic transformation region occurred only at the last
The end of all measurements was set at 50
C. For this reason, in the CCT diagram, there is no
. This is because it lies in negative temperatures, and our
